snippet: The decision allows the city to shed $7 billion in debt and to invest about $1.7 billion into long-neglected services after deals were struck with creditors.
abstract: Judge Steven W Rhodes approves Detroit's bankruptcy plan with remarkable speed, and with far less discord than many had foreseen, given the size of the city and complexity and depth of its financial woes; decision allows Detroit to shed $7 billion in debt and to invest about $1.7 billion into long-neglected services after deals were struck with creditors.

byline.original: By MONICA DAVEY and MARY WILLIAMS WALSH
byline.contributor: Monica Davey reported from Detroit, and Mary Williams Walsh from New York.

lead_paragraph: The decision allows the city to shed $7 billion in debt and to invest about $1.7 billion into long-neglected services after deals were struck with creditors.

headline.main: Plan to Exit Bankruptcy Is Approved for Detroit
headline.print_headline: Plan to Exit Bankruptcy Is Approved for Detroit
